I discovered these bars some time ago at my local grocery store - they were on this little display with some other things. The next time I went there, I couldn't find them. And I couldn't really remember what they were called. So, I was very excited when I saw them at Starbucks probably a year later. They are, of course, way too expensive there! I wasn't able to find them reliably anywhere around town, so I found them online and now I have two boxes (two different flavors) auto-shipped to me from Amazon. Now I have begun to see these in stores more often so I've been trying some other flavors.

I used to eat Kashi cereal each morning but now I have one of these bars with my requisite Dr. Pepper. I'm not sure how long ago I changed my breakfast choice, but I have lost about 15 pounds (that needed to be lost) since I changed over to the bars. I definitely didn't change earlier than November, 2010. And, instead of being starving at 11 a.m., I don't get seriously hungry until later.*

* These claims have not been evaluated by anyone, and no animals have been tortured to prove them. TL;DR:

When I first looked at this bonsai and the pictures of what other people had received, I thought this would be a great purchase. However, I bought the $6.95 tree from 9GreenBox instead of the $12.48 tree from Bonsai Boy. I wish I had spent the extra money. The tree cannot be more than a season and a half old (while the description says that it is a 3-year-old tree), and is about 3 1/2" - 4" tall. That being said, there is plenty of new growth and it was packaged well (no breakage and soil was still wet) and I received it quicker than I was expecting. TL;DR:
Tastey and straong for a bag tea. It really works as a sleep aid. It does have ingredents that may aggravate sensitive people. TL;DR:

this is a good product compared to many other of the same kind.  the purity is un matched, only thing i would like to see is a larger quantity for sale of this fine product as this would make it more cost efficient for daily use and not just when you want the best. TL;DR:

This is the best tasing kraut I have had so far. The flavor and the texture are both exquisite. It tastes like real German sauerkraut. Most of the kraut we buy at the store today does not have much taste, this is the exception.

The only thing that would make it better is if it were offered in a form that was packaged without pasteurization. That way, you would get the benefits of the good bacteria that naturally comes with sauerkraut. But, I realize that the packaging methods are much dicier that way. And the end product needs to be refrigerated for saftey.

Until I find an unpasteurized kraut that tastes this good I will keep buying this brand.The flavor is unmatched and very authentic taste. TL;DR:
I found this really offers a crunchy snack for me while doing the no carb diet.  However, I find I can make my own from shredded paremsan, almost as good! TL;DR:

These cherries are very tasty, but the organic part is the apple juice they are sweetened with, not the cherries. You would not know this  looking at the label.  For this I give it one star for misleading labeling. Cherries are a fruit typically found to be extremely high in pesticides.  I don't want to give inorganic cherries to my family. TL;DR:

These are the best strained tomatoes I have come across and very conveniently priced for the quality and taste. Think about how expensive organic tomatoes are and how many go into a 24 oz bottle! Not only are these organic, they taste so good. I've tried many different pasta sauces (quality, organic ones from Whole Foods) and none compare with this pure tomato paste. Just add heavy cream and you have an excellent pasta sauce (it is very, very good with Severino hand-nested egg based papardelle). Maybe storing the paste in a glass jar prevents metals from leaching into it and changing the taste? Thank you to the people at Bionaturae for this great product. TL;DR:

summary: Delicious and easy with great ingredients
text: These new sauces from Progresso are wonderful.  Each can makes 4 servings - with a recipe on the side of the can.  By going to http://progresso.com/RecipeStarters you can find lists of ideas for each of the sauces.  Purchasing a multi pack won't mean that your family has to have Parmesan chicken every day for 6 weeks.  The recipes are interesting and varied - from the standard pasta and sauce to pizza, rice dishes, casseroles and sandwiches.  These sauces make being a great cook easy!  I received a sample and coupons to try these products from BzzAgent - I love being a BzzAgent! TL;DR:

I ordered this wanting to try a hot chocolate on my Keurig, and I am very happy with this product. I will definitely be ordering it again. That being said, I dislike hot chocolate made completely of water, so I do add a splash of Half and Half to my cup when I make this. Thus, I didn't want to give it a 5 star rating since I do doctor my cup up a bit at home (otherwise I would have). However, I won't even venture to make a cup of hot chocolate in a packet from the grocery store with water, I use 100% milk usually for those and they still don't measure up to this product from Grove Square. So, the fact that this tastes so good made with water and a bit of creamer to me speaks volumes. I do have to say that this is by far the best cup of instant cocoa that I have ever tried at home. Compared to the Swiss Miss in the cupboard this had a distinctly grown up taste to it. I'm a big fan! TL;DR:

summary: Good product, wish for a better seller though...
text: The product arrived on time and was the correct flavor type. There was a problem though; when I opened the brown shipping box, it looked like whoever shipped it opened up my product and took out one of the pouches (it was a 12-pouch pack, the kind you would set up in a grocery store). I also ordered a different flavor at the same time from the same company, and that box was also missing a pouch. So in total, I was screwed out of 2 pouches of gum. I didn't bother sending the product back or complaining because let's face it, the trouble wasn't worth the $2 that the gum was worth. But still, kind of disappointing that someone would steal from their customer. TL;DR:

This food made my dog sick with vomiting and diarrhea for even two weeks after the transition from his other food. I've done my research, I think this is a complete kibble but too rich for Charlie. TL;DR:
it is gr8 because it is more like hot chocolate/coffee taste. esp, if u are sick of coffee everyday! TL;DR:

Medical studies have demonstrated that autistic children are more receptive to their therapy when on a strict gluten free diet. The problem is that children love to eat tasty chocolaty 'junk' food things. So how to satisfy their taste buds and maintain a gluten free diet? Alot of the gluten free stuff out there is non-palatable.

After MUCH trial and error we discovered this delicious chocolate chip cookie. We performed a blind taste test with all the Dream Factory tribe and this cookie stood at the top of the cookie heap. Flavorful crunchy. Microwaving for about 20 sec softens them up and brings out their chocolate flavor even more. Their small size (2" dia) is perfect for little hands.

Did you notice on the bags cover; the cookie on top to the right. The configuration of the chips makes a sad face.. . . Look.

Pamelas also makes a great pancack mix. TL;DR:

I had tried The Heat Is On and the Cinnamon Raisin Swirl and they were good but the Mighty Maple is outstanding.  I actually wouldn't mind a bit more maple but I am not disappointed in the flavor.  I love the crystals in the texture- like little flavor explosions in your mouth.  I was hesitant to buy a 6 pack, thinking we would never use them all but the first jar is half empty after just a few days.  We have used it in sandwiches and on cinnamon crackers.  Tomorrow we are going to use it on waffles! TL;DR:
These tins of mustard came super quick!! Great stuff!! As usual the quality of Colemans cannot be beat. TL;DR:
Good flavor and a good price too.  I like stronger coffees, and this is a nice bold cup without any bitterness. TL;DR:

This is the best line of products. It has helped clear up my acne and I've noticed the scars are slowly fading. I use the Aloe & Green Tea during the day and after washing my face before bed I use the Jasmine & Vitamin E cream. Our skin is very important and fragile, take care of it right! TL;DR:

summary: a darn good pitcher of tea
text: I have been making black tea in my bodum iced tea pitcher and wanted to try a nice loose green. This one works perfectly. It has a mild taste that is very fresh. TL;DR:

summary: Clear Scalp and Hair Beauty Total Care Shampoo
text: This shampoo has a nice scent; is creamy and left our hair soft and clean. My wife loved it. The shape of the container needs to be done better. It has a flat top; I guess when it is near empty, you may turn it over, but it will leak that way. Overall though, a great product. TL;DR:

There were some reviews concerning the saltiness of this product.  The nutrition panel on the tin appears to be inaccurate both in measure and sodium content.  1 tsp is not 10grams! Less than 3grams actually. Most commercial curry powders seem to add salt, why I don't know. I usually make my own but this has a good authentic flavor and is nice to have on the shelf ready to go. TL;DR:

Upon reading the other reviewer's comments, I tend to think that the chestnuts may have been improperly stored - healthful foods rot faster than unhealthful ones (the microorganisms know what's good!) As far as these chestnuts are concerned, they are DELICIOUS! I was actually surprised that they are as good as they are because I thought that since they save you all the trouble of roasting and shelling that you would have to compromise somewhat on taste. Not so! Excellent product. A delicious AND healthful snack. TL;DR:

I like the fact that all the ingredients are natural and healthy. I like the fact that when mixed with my dogs dinner she doesn't notice it. I like the fact that she has a wiggle in her hips again. I can notice the difference in her movement when she has her healthy motion mix. TL;DR:

I wouldn't feed this to my dog!
This is nothing more than Hamburger Helper, just in a prettier box.

By the time that it takes you to grill the beef, boil the noodles, & add the sauce and seasonings, you could of just made a healthy and nutritious meal for your family. I could of made eggplant Parmesan in less time (with a salad)...Yuck! TL;DR:
My son loves all the happy Tot foods we have tried. If he see's me putting them away he gets so excited and wants one right then. TL;DR:

summary: Baby gobbles the whole thing everytime!
text: My daughter LOVES these, so far every "superfood" variety I have tried, she eats the whole thing, loves for me to squeeze it right into her mouth ever, lol. TL;DR:

This oil is far superior to Spanish or Italian olive oils and to many Greek. A First Cold Pressing, there are no additives or preservatives so the oil has a light, clean taste. I use it extensively in salads and over pasta dishes.

I am extremely pleased with the quality of this product. TL;DR:

I bought a case of this for my family and it went fast. Everyone loves it. It's crunchy, sweet,and the raisins are good. Makes a great late-night snack for Dad and a quick breakfast grab on the way out the door for the kids. A good choice for camping grub, too. Healthy adults might need two packs for a good breakfast, but my kids seem fine with one.

I eat mine straight out of the box with my coffee and it's great. The Granola was fresh and tasty and the raisins added a nice bit of flavor. It's just what you expect and good. Recommended. TL;DR:
These are my favorite of the Be Kind bars. They're so tasty and keep me satisfied during the late afternoon hours when I'm feeling like a snack! Definitely good and good for you! TL;DR:

This jam is amazing.  You would never know it is sugar free and the super bonus is that xylitol is so good for your teeth!  This jam, more than the other Nature's Hollow jams (which I also LOVE) seems to be packed with whole fruit.  The flavor is fantastic and worth every dime of the added expense! TL;DR:

This is my absolute favorite packaged Enchilada Sauce mix.  It's better than any other packaged mix or jarred Enchilada Sauce that you can buy.  When prepared, it's not too thin and not too thick, consistency-wise.  I can definitely tell a BIG difference in my chicken enchiladas when I have to use a different sauce mix.  My husband and kids love these enchiladas when I use this sauce mix- they can even tell the difference. Lawry's is the best, hands down. TL;DR:
The contents settle to the bottom of the pack and you really can't get it out,it's not conveient.I am not going to order it again.Jason's almond butter packets are much better. TL;DR:
I really liked the flavor of this coffee but it is very oily and it clogs up my grinder every time. :-( TL;DR:

My grandmother and I shared a deep love for tapioca pudding. I know a lot of people don't like it but it's always been one of my favorites. I use a modified version of her recipe.
This doesn't cut tapioca time to a minute, but the soaking time and cooking time isn't as long. You can decide at 3 you want tapioca for dessert tonight and actually make it by dinner time instead of the 24 hour soaking time that the regular tapioca pearls can take.
The grains of tapioca are smaller than regular pearls so you'll have lots of little bits instead of bigger chewy bites. It's more like the commercial preparations. I'll still take the time to make the pearl kind occasionally, but this makes a sudden whim for tapioca doable. TL;DR:

I feel good using this food. My schnauzer was having minor food allergies and I had trouble finding food without grains and by-products  The price was good and even better with the auto order and free shipping.  I live in a rural area that doesn't carry Paul Newman foods so door to door delivery was great.  Will use it again. TL;DR:

summary: Both Tasty and a Great Sleep Aid
text:
The only problem that I have with this item is that it does not in fact put you in a mellow mood. It knocks you out completely. Within an hour of drinking this, I have a really hard time staying awake. That's why I purchased it though, to relax and eventually help get me to sleep. I have also not noticed any side effects with my sleep, when drinking this multiple nights in a row and then stopping, like most sleep aids.

It is also really tasty. It holds up extremely well against any other fruit beverage. This may be a con though as constantly wanting to drink a beverage that knocks you out can't be good for your social or work life. TL;DR:

My only wish is that this can could be bigger...it says that it makes up to 24 quarts but I like to use 1 1/2 cups to make it a little bit stronger using a Gatorade water bottle I bought from Amazon too. I've tried using my CamelBak water bottle with a bite valve, but if it isn't washed out right away it will start to mold up a little on the inside of the bite valve like if I try to use it for night time drinking. TL;DR:

summary: Very Satisfied with this dog food
text: Our dog kept shedding really bad so we switched to this food and it has basically stopped her shedding!  We love the price of it since we have a large dog and go thru a bag a month.  We will recommend this dog food to others. TL;DR:
My dogs are nuts for the Dogswell Happy Hips dried chicekn breasts but they are made in China so I hardly ever give them to my dogs.I wish the company would have them manufactured elsewhere. TL;DR:

These unsalted pretzels are by far the best quick snack i have found.  no salt on the pretzel, virtually no fat, and very good taste.  the direct sale from snyders with no shipping cost ensure my repeat business. TL;DR:

This licorice is sooooo good. Soft, very flavorful. Hard to find in stores
now- this flavor- black cherry- so I would recommend. TL;DR:
This is a good tea. I do notice that, sometimes, the tea has a very cloudy appearance that alters the taste. Is this common with this brand? TL;DR:

Darjeeling tea used to be widely available at local supermarkets. However, as a plethora of tea varieties claimed shelf space in the tea section, Darjeeling has become increasingly difficult to find. As a dedicated Darjeeling fan, this became exasperating. Ordering my Darjeeling from Amazon eliminated my need to search out the store that carried my favorite flavor. Better yet, I get my favorite tea at a price lower than any local supermarket.  I am very pleased with the convenience and the low cost! TL;DR:
I have not ordered yet, my question is, from the description, it is 24 bags at 0.8 ounces. How does this equal 192 ounces in total weight? TL;DR:

Read the fine print, I apparently did not... "Includes dark roast, medium roast, decaf"
My shipment contained 5 decaf cups. TL;DR:

summary: White Chocolate: Took one bite, threw entire box away
text: These bars have a core of unappetizing protein goo, covered with a thin sheath of white chocolate analog. It didn't taste like white chocolate and even my roommate couldn't stomach these. TL;DR:

summary: Just as good as ever! High quality, natural ingrediants :)
text:
I suppose I should be embarrassed o admit publicly that I climbed up on my grandmother's counters to get to where she had these hidden away on a high shelf (so us kids couln't get to them)... That was a long long time ago, and much has changed since, not least of which as how difficult it now is to find any kind of wholesome packaged food. When it comes to candy, cookies, sweets, people seem even more willing to close their eyes to what is in them. After all, we know this is an indulgence and not something we are buying or consuming for it's nutritional value, right? That does not mean it has to be bad for you! or that you have to put up with things which are not food grade in your food! and this product proves the point:) I am really glad to find that they are still as good as I remembered them to be, and that the company has not succumbed to the temptation to pad profits by using inferior ingredients. These are both really good, and... well, while not good for you per se, they are not bad for you; no trans fats, no chemically altered ingredients. It's something you can feel good about giving your kids (or even yourself).
I should not be here writing this up, should not even have opened the box (I did buy them for my son.... to show him what chocolate covered marshmellows should taste like), but these sat in the post office in 100 degree heat for 4 days, so I opened them to make sure they weren't ruined. That was the beginning of the dn :O I am glad my order was for 4 boxes....so there will (probably) be some left when he gets home from school ;) TL;DR:

summary: A little bit changed with Maxwell House in charge, but still good!
text: This item used to be available as "General Foods International" and has since switched over to Maxwell House.  It also used to be availabls to me in my area; it has been off the shelves for months now and I was very happy to find a supply on Amazon under the new ownweship.  I have tried other chai mixes, powdered and liquid but this is hands down the best and easiest one to make.  Make it with milk to get the best flavor.  Now if only Amazon would make it a subscription like they used to have it when it was with General Foods! TL;DR:

My wife and I are coffee drinkers. We love the stuff. We're addicted. We've got just about every manner of coffee making device you can think of in our home, from French presses to cheap and expensive coffee making machines. And we have a one cup pod machine, sitting next to our Keruig machine.

Why do we have all this coffee making paraphernalia? We're old, we've had more anniversaries, birthdays and Christmases than most and everybody we know, knows we love coffee.

The above being said, how do I rate this coffee? And how does my wife rate this coffee? Four thumbs up, that's what we give it. Delicious. Just one word to describe it, that's all this coffee needs. Delicious. I'll say it again, Delicious. TL;DR:
I will definitely re-order this product. It is great for portion control, for lunches and for quick snacks. TL;DR:

I have never had sea salt before, but I'll tell you, I'm hooked!  This is an excellent product, and tastes better than iodized salt.  I understand it's supposed to be better for you too.  You won't go wrong with this product. TL;DR:
NOT OFTEN TO I FIND A CEREAL TO RAVE ABOUT, BUT I GIVE THIS CEREAL RAVE REVIEWS! TL;DR:

These bars are delicious!!! I've always been a sucker for coconut and almond so I figured this flavor of Kind Bars would be right up my alley. I was right.

The bars are incredibly soft and moist; they bend by themselves if you hold them horizontally. The crunch of the almonds plus the sweetness of the coconut and honey is so tasty, it's hard to have just one bar. Amazon makes a good deal. Only about a dollar per bar when I ordered them. I will definitely order more :) TL;DR:

Although it's much more expensive than ramen noodles, these are much more substantial and feel like an actual meal. Easy to prepare and delicious. I'll take these over regular instant noodles any day. TL;DR:

summary: they dont diserve a star. the cookies expired in 2009
text: the tea buscuits expired in june 2009. they are stale. the absolute never trust these people. they will not let you return the product or replace with ones that havnt expired.  do not ever do business with this person or company TL;DR:

This product came in expired and of course stale.  I purchased this for a school party and ended it using it as bird food.  I was very disappointed. The only reason I didn't send it back was because I opened them before tasting it.  I will never buy anything from this seller again. TL;DR:

Van Houtte Cafe, Costa Rica Tarrazu (Light Roast) Coffee, 24-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2)

Of all the coffees I tried since getting my Keurig, this is the best so far. This is my 3rd refill. My suggestion is to try using a Capresso frothPRO that also got on Amazon. Makes great crema using skim milk. Then add a spoonful of Splenda Brown Sugar Blend for Baking - 16 OZ, mmmmmmmm good! TL;DR:

summary: If at first they don't taste good...
text:
I think I first heard about Mallomars from Babysitters Club books when I was a kid. Maybe they were one of the foods Claudia stashed in her room? She was always eating brand name junk food my mother wouldn't buy me. So I was really looking forward to these cookies. If a fictional character from my childhood loved them, they have to be delicious, right?

I did not love these cookies at first bite. They seemed dry and I didn't like that the chocolate was a thin hard shell. I also wasn't remotely hungry when I first tried them. Although I really did like the marshmallow. Also, the packaging isn't very storage friendly. But I figure that's what tupperware and plastic bags are for.

Then I came home from work one night, hungry. They were pretty satisfying, and the more I ate the more I loved that the outer shell of chocolate was crisp. Now I only have two left. I think I'll go eat them right now... TL;DR:

Tully's house blend coffee is a bold coffee that isn't bitter but delivers good coffee flavor.  I use the K-cups for that perfect cup of coffee every time.  I was looking for a replacement for the Kona blend coffee since it has become very difficult to find and the prices have sky rocketed to ridiculousness when you do find it.  This house blend has been a good replacement. TL;DR:

My little eater isn't picky, but the spinach, mango and pear is his favorite food of all.  The food is tasty, although it's a little bit expensive at Amazon.  The grocery store and the big boxes tend to have this one a little bit cheaper.  Thankfully, Happy foods are becoming increasingly easy to find.  Good products and tasty foods = well, Happy Baby! TL;DR:
I used these for chocolate chips, and was amazed. A little pricey for that purpose, but here I am looking for more. TL;DR:

I was looking for an easy and convenient way to add lean protein to my diet on my training days.  A friend suggested I try these, so I did.  They are really tasty!  The jerky strips are really yummy as well.  You will not be disappointed if you buy these.  They were also much cheaper than buying at a local "health food" store! TL;DR:

summary: So, so, so disappointed with Lipton
text: Lipton came out with the new "with Honey" mixes and I can no longer find the Green Tea to Go with Citris anywhere (okay, well, I could find it here for $10k and other places for 2 to 3 times as much as it was in the grocery store... can you say scalping?!)I hope that the with Honey stuff is a big flop so that they bring back the stuff I like.  And yes, I did try the new stuff, but I prefer the old. TL;DR:

Gracie (our miniature Dachshund) absolutely loves this "lick stick".  She comes running when she sees me get it out.  The only drawback is that when I put it back away, she looks  at me like I am the meanest person ever. TL;DR:

summary: Fantastic low calorie potato chip substitute.
text: My husband and I both enjoy these. Crunchy and flavorful. A serving is approximately 30 cracker chips for, I believe, 110 calories. Can't beat that. Prefer the plain to other flavors. Only downside is they have a fair amount of sodium for those who are watching their salt intake. TL;DR:
I love the coffee pods!  I don't have to wait for it to brew and cleanup is very quick!  Hot coffee...YUMMM! TL;DR:
I can tell you it arrived in good shape and in good timing.  We have not opened it yet though. TL;DR:
Saved a heap of money ordering this off Amazon.com. The mac and cheese had doesn't expire until nov. 2012 and that makes me happy. TL;DR:
These chips are great. I love the hot and spicy seasoning. They are too spicy for my 5 year old, but my 8 year old loves them also. TL;DR:

summary: Great salsa - what's up with the new price?
text: This stuff is great. I ordered a three pack last week for $13.39 here at amazon. I went to re-order today and's it's $18.74. What's up with that? This stuff is good, but at the new price ...I will definitely pass. TL;DR:

Honey Maid Graham crackers have been around for years and they taste the same. It's a dependable snack that isn't too high in sugar. In fact, the nursing facility I work at allows graham crackers and milk as an approved snack for their diabetics.

The packaging is ideal, and will probably result in less waste of crackers that aren't eaten immediately, as these crackers become stale overnight once opened. You get 8 crackers in each individually wrapped snack, which, in my opinion is more than twice what one person should eat in one sitting. Institutions are sold graham crackers packaged in two's, and that would be better, I think.

As another reviewer mentioned: these crackers drop a lot of crumbs when broken apart. Therefore, these snacks are better eaten outside, or directly over a plate.

If I had to choose between purchasing graham crackers packaged in bigger portions, and these smaller packages, I'd pick the smaller. While I am still wasting some crackers due to staleness, it's not nearly as many as before. TL;DR:

definetly enhances the flavor of wine. Brings it to life more. Tastes great looks cool and is a fun thing to keep around the house and show off at a party.

I tried it once and now i am purchasing it TL;DR:

Amazing tea, difficult to find. I'm glad that Amazon.com carry this line of product now! I've tried around 10 kinds of Miracle Tea and every kind is unique so far. Very affordable, for the price unexpectedly outstanding quality. Full leaf, real fruits. Switched from teavana to Miracle Tea. They are flat priced as well - so it's really difficult to choose best from the best. TL;DR:
I went to Cafe Britt on my honeymoon in Costa Rica.  This was our favorite coffee.  It reminds me of our trip every time! TL;DR:

These k-cups are certainly bold and strong, but the finish is flat and thin.  It's lacking in overtones after the inital dark wave.  I just started exploring k-cups since my machine arrived last week.  Initially I was surprised how watery the house blends are.  I wanted something dark and rich in texture.  But so far, I'd rather drink Tully's French Roast extra bold k-cups which is just about as strong as Dark Magic but with a wider spectrum and better finish. TL;DR:

The chocolates are only a third of a size of a normal chocolate bar. They are like KINDER size. A little disappointment for my BIG sweet tooth...
They are pretty delicious though. I very much loved the lavender flavor to them.
I found the chocolates to be less sweet that typical American chocolate with the white bar being the sweetest.
Overall these bars are a great gift... (for a little kid lol)
But if I realized that I would be paying $20 for a total of one Cadbury-size chocolate bar, I'd think again... TL;DR:

If you appreciate good quality chocolate you'll enjoy this! This is a very generous size bar that's firm (great for grating), but also has a luscious, creamy feel as it melts in your mouth. It has just enough sweetness. Since consumers are drawn to packaging first, I would suggest jazzing up the wrapper a bit so they'll choose it over other brands and find out how good it is inside! TL;DR:
These cookies are better than any cookies i have tasted. I am very particular about low fat, gulten free items because they do not taste as they should, but these are very GOOD. TL;DR:
My wife loves our local Road Ranger gas station cappuccino. Nothing else will do, until now. I no longer have to go out in the cold/rain as long as I keep these in stock. TL;DR:
this is a very mild and non bitter coffee with a hint of hazelnut flavor. I add a little hazelnut flavored creamer and enjoy a really good cup of coffee. TL;DR:

The description of this item is utterly misleading. The Web page lists the shipping weight at 1 lb, yet what one receives for $21 is 7 ounces of cookies. This is misrepresentation and a ripoff. The merchant did not respond to my complaint. TL;DR:

My dog loves them, can carry in my pocket while on a walk for quick treats to help with training (acting appropriately around strangers) and then no crumbs in my pocket!  Little pricey, but I think they're worth it. (hence the 4 stars) TL;DR:
These Kind bars have got to be one of the BEST!  Whenever I am having a chocolate craving, a chocolate cherry & cashew bar will definitely fix it.  They arrived in perfect condition!! TL;DR:
GLORIA JEAN HAZELNUT K-CUPS ARE MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE K-CUPS  GAVE AWAY MANY OTHER FLAVORS THAT I DID NOT LIKE  BUT I WILL NOT GIVE THESE AWAY TL;DR:

I lived in Germany for almost 20 years, I absolutely fell in love with the Asbach filled candies, they are the very, very best anywhere in the world. I would Highly Recommend them and know you'll really love them. There are look-alikes on the market, but NONE as great as these. TL;DR:

I make all my daughters food and thankfully she prefers what I make over jar food. I do have those times when I need something quick to grab on the go. Ella's Organics is a great go to. Paying this much for one pouch is a huge huge rip off. Usually Babies R Us has them for $1 - $1.40 most likely on sale for a dollar though. I am really happy with the Happy Baby brand too ... also almost $2 a pouch but usually on sale. Just last night my local grocery store had a 10/$10 sale on this brand.

Seek out this product just never for this price!! Yikes. TL;DR:

I have always loved All Sorts Licorice candy but found it difficult to find in stores. My daughter found it on your Web Site and gave it to me for Christmas. By January all 6 pounds + were gone and we ordered more. It freezes nicely so I sorted it into 10 packages. I'm being a little less greedy this time but, it's still going fast. You'll be hearing from me with another order soon.  Thanks for carrying this item. TL;DR:

I was so glad to have found this online. Amazon is amazing! It has opened up a whole world of finding organic, gluten free, vegan, etc ingredients that are hard to find in the local grocery stores. I'm saying this particular item is all of those things, but it was a great find and at a reasonable price. My husband and I are dieting and keep seeing this listed in a lot of recipes and couldn't find it locally. I went on Amazon and here it was waiting for me :-) TL;DR:
The slots wernt exactly evenly spaced and its a bit stiff to pull out/push in. But bottom line it works! And looks good! For the price, can't beat it. TL;DR:

We have been using K=Cups for our Keurig for years now. This is the first time we have gotten a box where all the k-cups are defective. The tops apparently aren't on right because every cup gets coffee grounds in it.

Horrible! TL;DR:

summary: This deserves more stars than possible
text: This is far and away one of the best sauces on the planet.  I eat it on anything and everything meaty... and sometimes not meaty.  Great to dip your fries in instead of ketchup (or as my grandmother used to say cat-sup).  The wife uses this in meatloaf instead of the previously mentioned ingredient.  If you have not tried this sauce, and you like things a little spicy, this is your sauce... TL;DR:

I thought I knew horseradish having grown up in the upper midwest, where horseradish was often home-grown, and a staple condiment
at the dinner table.

A recent visit to a restaurant in Manhattan Beach, CA found me with a dollop of Horseradish on my plate that completely REDEFINED my
beliefs on GOOD horseradish!

I asked the Waitress what this phenomenal horseradish was....and she showed me a jar of "Atomic".

That closed the deal. Case proven....Atomic is the best!

This is the best you can buy! Don't hesitate. TL;DR:

Pick up the bag, give it a shake and your cat will come running. They'll start purring before you even get the bag open.  I give about 5-6 of these to my cats every day and they gobble them right up.  Leaves their breath 'better' than normal (not like they've just brushed or anything) and they never leave any behind. TL;DR:

Missing the flavor of shortbread because of gulten intolerance? Try the line of Pamela's cookies and products. This cookie is sweet, crunchy goodness with out the gluten, large chunks of dark chocolate round out a flavorful treat. TL;DR:

text:
Stay away and dont waste money. I guess the other reviews are from people who were paid or from people who have never tasted real coconut water.
I am from India and have grown up drinking real coconut water. This is as bad as any of them( i have tried many brands). Its not worth buying coconut water in a packaged form. TL;DR:

We live just northwest of Houston. When I asked about getting this flavor of Jell-O at our local stores(even Wal-Mart!), I was told that even if they could get this flavor, it would be a long process.
I got on the internet and had the Jell-O delivered within a week.
For my needs, the availability of the product was my most important situation. The product itself was excellent and gave my salad the flavor that I was after.

Thank you very much,

Linda Mitchell TL;DR:

summary: Not bad but a little hard to get used to
text: My husband likes these a lot. They are a bit different to get used to as they are less greasy and salty in taste than the usual chips you buy. They are more browner than I would like to see and the chips are pretty sturdy in texture. Not bad, though. Just takes getting used to eating chips better for your health. They do have about 1/2 the calories in fat, however. TL;DR:
this milk is ok to make yogurt. However you really need a blender if you are going to use it.  That is the only way to remove the lumps.  It is kind of sticky. overall ok. TL;DR:

summary: Good on Its Own; Best with Hot Sauce!
text: I like this well enough, but I soon get sick of the somewhat plain taste so I need to spice it up with at least a few packets of black or white pepper!  Even better is hot sauce, such as Tabasco or some such thing.  Unfortunately, ten ounces just ain't enough for me: I need at least two of these bowls for a meal! TL;DR:

A healthy adult take on childhood favorite grahams, these crackers contain a lot of whole grains, and nothing mysterious in the ingredients list. At 110 calories for 2 cracker "sheets", they would seem a wholesome snack.

Compared to "traditional" graham crackers, the texture is firmer, with less of the dissolve-in-your-mouth; they're a bit more effort eat. I normally use graham crackers mostly to make dessert crusts; I'm not sure the oat-heavy crackers are the the best choice for that purpose. Since I don't like to stock more than one kind of grahams, I dropped my rating by 1 star.

The pleasingly readable ingredients list, the 55% post-consumer recycled box, and the stamp of the Nature Conservancy (a respected habitat preservation group) help give credibility to the "Back to Nature" branding.

Recommended. TL;DR:

summary: Cocoa Powder With Rich Chocolate Flavor
text:
LOTS of chocolate powder--this box measures 3" x 5" by 6"! But it's the perfect size for me, now that I'm making my own chocolate ice cream.

This excellent "Dutch process" powder imparts a full, rich, delicious chocolate flavor to ice cream (and presumably to hot cocoa, cakes, cookies, or anything else you might use it for). It's real cocoa--100% natural unsweetened cocoa. This is the same Hershey's cocoa powder that is sold in grocery stores in 8-oz. boxes. By purchasing this "economy size", I paid about 55 cents per ounce (including Amazon Prime shipping), instead of about 69 cents per ounce (for three 8-oz. boxes at a local store). TL;DR:

If you enjoy real Thai tea, then you will not enjoy this product.

This doesn't even taste like Thai tea. I'm not sure what it tastes like. Some random assortment of chemicals. It tastes very artificial.

I strongly recommend you find real Thai tea (the kind you brew) to make your own Thai tea at home.

Avoid this mix! TL;DR:

What is there to say about granola and chocolate mixed together? Plenty if it is done as well as this Back to Nature treat is. The combo is a nice break from boring granola but without the guilt of pure chocolate or candy. It is a very dry snack so have a liquid handy. The chocolate is a little biter which detracts from the overall flavor resulting in a 4. TL;DR:

These chips are some of the best I've tasted. They are not filled with chemicals. You taste the tangy vinegar as well as the potato. Not greasy. Perfectly crispy. If you don't like salt and vinegar tanginess, don't even bother to try. These definitely have zip. I love them. My children and their friends love them. Even my 4 year old loves them! TL;DR:

I have been drinking Essentia Water for the past year after a friend introduced me to Ph correct alkaline water. I used to take gallons from her ionic filter, but after a while I needed to find a new source. Another friend sent a list of alkaline waters in which Essentia was one of them. I have been hooked ever since. Not only is it one of the highest Ph waters avaiable, it is highly hydrating so you get more hydration for your gulps. But it also tastes really good and quenches the thirst thoroughly! A case lasts me about a month, so it is also cost-efficient. Now that it is sold through Amazon, the shipping is free. Great water, great price, and you feel great after drinking it! TL;DR:

I buy this food for my Supers' cat that he decided to put in the street. Since I'm a volunteer @ my local shelter, which by the way does not have room for another stray, I decided to spay, vaccinate and feed the cat. She seems to love this food more than any other brand. Great buy as well! TL;DR:

I found Tings to be a really good substitute for Cheetos for my 2 children who are on the Gluten Free/Casein Free Diet.  They are 6yrs and 3yrs old and had no problems switching to Tings.  I enjoy them myself! TL;DR:

summary: Good cat food for a good price
text: This cat food isn't the highest quality, but it is definitely not the worst. It's far better than any of the Purina cat chows available, all of which are offered at a similar price per pound. For the price, this is the best cat food on the market, and you can't beat free shipping! TL;DR:

Despite the upper crust British sounding name, Bentley's fine teas are not so fine. The tea is barely more than colored water; we have tried lots of different types and brands of tea and this was the most disappointing. The presentation is nice to look at, but the tea is not so nice to drink. TL;DR:

text:

Eva C. TL;DR:

summary: Not bad, but rather bland -- I added berries
text:
I am a big fan of Krusteaz muffin mixes -- I usually bake several dozen once a month or so (oat bran and fat-free banana are my favorites), then freeze them and have a couple for breakfast every morning (I nuke them on high for about 10 seconds each and they are ready). I had never tried this kind before as it's not one my local grocery stores carry, so I bought a case from amazon. The first time I baked them, they smelled AMAZING in the oven and I was looking forward to trying them. Unfortunately, I was disappointed by the taste -- they were just very, very, very bland. They tasted to me somewhat like vanilla muffins (I can't taste anything like almonds in them), but actually they didn't have much of a taste at all.

With my second box, I added frozen mixed berries (blueberries, strawberries, blackberries, raspberries) to the mix -- I think about a cup or cup and a half of the berries (no need to defrost them first). This improved the taste quite a bit, so I think this muffin mix just needs SOMETHING added.

I will continue to add fruit (maybe nuts too at some point) to the 10 boxes I have left, but I doubt that I will order any more. I really wanted to like these and am surprised no one else mentioned how bland they are. (Maybe it's just me.) TL;DR:
I should have believed an earlier review about these being advertised as chopped, they are more like minced, very disappointing, returning to chicken of the sea chopped TL;DR:

Purchased one bag at a natural foods store -
everyone in my family came to enjoy its'
sweet flavor. Purchased through Amazon (a
6 pack) and saved $. TL;DR:

Amazon sent a replacement, and they were only a hair better. Still leaking and dented up. Not sure if it is just this product or if it is just cans in general, but I would not order again. TL;DR:

I also found these chips to be very fresh, from the first bag to the last! I'll most likely be placing another order in the near future, I'm sure!

L. Nakao TL;DR:

summary: Excellent choice for my finicky feline!
text: Since my elderly cat has started eating a wet food diet, she's become extremely finicky. She used to eat anything I'd put in front of her, until about a year ago when she decided nothing was good enough.  I'd been through every brand in the store...she doesn't like fish, plain chicken or lamb so my choices were limited.  When I found this, I gave it a try since she primarily likes beef. The ingredients were excellent and I read great reviews from Vets about it online.  She has been scarfing this food down from day 1 and still loves it. There are peas and carrots in it and the  consistency of it is very mushy. She likes it that way, so she doesn't have to chew much. I also noticed it doesn't dry out if there's any left in her bowl for several hours, like other brands have.  I definitely plan to continue giving this to her. I've been ordering on Amazon since it's been difficult to find it in my local pet stores lately. TL;DR:

This is the first time I ordered, I hadn't read the reviews, which I know I should have. The product was very very sweet, and I like sweet. I kept the coffee, BUT, personally this might be ok if I make it as an iced coffee for the summer.  I guess if you like extra sweet, this is the coffee for you. TL;DR:

JUNE 2012 UPDATE: All three trees are growing strong, standing at about 4 inches tall now. I've had them in pots all winter long, sitting in my window to catch sunlight. I think they'll be ready for bigger pots soon!

There's something to be said for growing and nuturing something from the start. I thought about buying a bonsai from my local greenhouse for $30-$45, but I like the idea of being able to shape my bonsai the way I wanted to, not follow what somebody already started. The instructions were very easy to follow, and I got three seeds to sprout! I was even able to transplant all three to their own individual pots with no problems (just make sure to go quick so the root doesn't dry out!) I highly recommend to anyone wanting to start their own bonsai, or just grow their own trees for a project during the winter! TL;DR:

My cat loves Tiki cat, and the flavours in the variety pack are her top favourites. I try to give these to her 1 out of every 4 meals since cats are not supposed to eat a lot of fish.

Though I first ordered this from Amazon, I now order it from National Pet Pharmacy as it is listed for $10 there, and with their promo codes and if you're willing to buy in bulk, you can get get a discount on the shipping cost and a great deal for this overall. TL;DR:

I haven't bought Wellness through Amazon yet, but the prices are very competitive and will do so.  After discovering they carried Wellness, wanted to comment on the product.  When I adopted my cat, she came with unrevealed health problems.  She was on a nebulizer every day, no energy, vomiting and more.  As one reviewer stated, I did some internet research.  I tried some of the top of the line natural foods.  Once I got her on the Wellness wet food, her health was a complete turnaround.  She's twelve and acts like four or five years of age.  No more health problems.  The consistency is smooth, a potential problem for a lot of cats that won't eat chunky foods.  I absolutely can not recommend this food more highly.  The dry, is very small pieces and she's slow to eat it, but I keep it as a 'treat' food.  The wet is perfect in every way. TL;DR:

I cant find this stuff in any of my local stores anymore. They used to sell it in kroger but stopped about 8 months ago. Here on amazon it is cheaper per bag and as fresh as ever. I take a bag of this with me when i go out riding my motorcycle or kayaking or rock climbing and it gives me the energy i need to stay strong all afternoon. I defenitely prefer the dried cranberries over the raisins in most trail mixes and the cocoa roasted almonds blow plain ones away. Theres no going back to generic trail mix after this. TL;DR:
Cracker Jack is an old, old favorite. I have already orered it three times. Intend to order it again when present supply runs low. TL;DR:
I wouldn't buy this again.  The bottle is hard to work with and the pancakes are just not that good.  I prefer the original pancake mix and not this one. TL;DR:

summary: Best Dog food on the market!!
text: I recently switched my GSD/Greyhound mix to this food as he was experiencing food sensitivities and bacterial overgrowth in his small intestines. The vet at his renowned NYC area clinic recomended probiotics as well as a food change to a single protein food along with one that has no wheat, corn etc as these are top foods causing this. Also eagle has probiotics within the formula. The difference in his 6 year old demeaner is amazing..more energy, stools are consistent and also turns out it has glucosamine in it which also helps his hips as he inherited the bad hips from his GSD blood lines.  Also, it turns out my brothers purebred champion hunting and show dog pedigree lined golden retriever also is on this line of food as recomended by the breeder. He uses the high protein formula when she is in hunting competition, and in the thick of bird season.  Works wonders and man is she a strong muscled bitch!! Can't say enough about this food...just try it if you really love your canine!! TL;DR:

summary: Too much caramel cream, not enough coffee
text: If you like your flavored coffee to taste like coffee, this may not be for you.  I couldn't taste the coffee at all in the travel size brew, but the smaller brew sizes were a bit better. TL;DR:

summary: Decent but Not Particularly Strong Coffee
text: The first thing you will notice with Marley Coffee is it smells really good.  Unfortunately once you brew it is not as strong as I would like it, but still a serviceable coffee.  These are single pod coffee packages, individually wrapped to keep them fresh until you use them with fifteen per box.  And even though it does not mean anything for the overall taste, the packaging is attractive with a slit you can make at the bottom of the box to remove the pods (or just open the top normally is you like).  Just do not ask me what it has to do with Bob Marley. TL;DR:

I love this brand. If you go to their website, sign up for their newsletters. They'll send you $3.00 off coupons every couple of months or so. No so helpful when purchasing through amazon but helpful if you have a local store with Amazon similar pricing like I do ;)

My dog loves this food. He suffered from some stomach problems when he was a puppy so I switched him to Innova. I loved Innova, but my puppy didn't - his hair became oily, he didn't seem interested in the food, he began to smell bad, and the stomach issues continued. I did more research, switched to Wellness, and everything cleared up! I like the clean ingredients, the way his coat looks, and how he NEVER has bad breath or puppy farts. Ever. TL;DR:
Not enough chai flavor to balance the thin chocolate taste.  I've loved other Rishi teas but this was very disappointing. TL;DR:
this is the only chew my dog will eat..they are clean and do not leave brown "baste" stains on carpet..keeps my pup's breath fresh. TL;DR:

Glutino Gluten free pretzel sticks taste as good as pretzels with wheat flour.
The crunch and texture are excellent.
People not exposed to gluten free foods also enjoyed the pretzel. TL;DR:

Love this product; have used it in the past but unfortuanately it broke after a couple of years.  We do not put our leftover wine away without using the stoppers which really help to keep the wine fresh TL;DR:

Convenient, cost effective and delicious. I went to the local grocery store and for the same amount of money, the ingredients weighed about half the weight of Great Northern. Worth the buy and I recommend it.

I just don't recommend following the included instructions. Before you turn it on, add the oil, then turn it on and add the rest of the ingredients ... you won't accidentally melt the plastic package. IMHO TL;DR:

We don't use this as a regular diet, but rather for "cat treats", because our cats absolutely love it. We don't believe it is as healthy and beneficial as implied after reading the ingredient list, but it is still ahead of most commercial dry foods. However, the price here is not too good; we buy the 3 lb bags from Trader Joe's for 6.49 each, which of course would be about nineteen & a half bucks for three. TL;DR:

On the label, it says "FRESH UDON," and whoa... was I surprised how good the udon tasted for an instant package that you could prepare in 3 min.  The udon noodles itself had that solid, chewy texture that was just right.  This soup has really good flavor and I would say it's the best instant udon that I've eaten so far. TL;DR:

summary: No real (vegan) cheese, just a little tiny, very little tiny seasoning sprinkle
text: With all due respect, friends, this product seemed to me greatly misleading.  This is no real (vegan) cheese for one to prepare a sandwich or a vegan pizza.  It is just a little--very tiny little--sprinkle that resembles "cheese".  The photograph is quite misleading.  It suggests that we are purchasing something like a cheese pack.  This is not the case.  We are talking about a very, very, tiny bottle (similar to a medication bottle) with not even a handful of "cheese" sprinkle.  It is strictly speaking just a seasoning, not actual, melting, substantial vegan cheese.  Since they sell this cheese-seasoning for over 24 dollars (with shipping) for 4 tiny little bottles, one actually pays 6 dollars a piece...!  How's that!?  I tried to give it a final chance and poured an entire of one of those little bottles over a bread slice in the toaster, just to see what would happen with a little heat.  The thing turned into black ashes.  Six dollars directly into the trash container!  I felt deceived, to say the least.  So, if you are looking for actual, substantial, eatable, melting vegan cheese, try elsewhere (for example, in the US, Daya vegan cheese is my first choice--but there are a few other options and more are being launched in the market).  Peace!  Go vegan!  One day, as we hope, there will be no such a thing as vegan cheese any longer, as all cheese will be vegan, and children will not even know, by then, that there was a time in human journey in which we had to struggle to leave our fellow animals in quiet and peace!  Best regards to all from Brazil!  Claudio TL;DR:
I have tried many strengths of coffee.  The Timothy's Midnight Magic Extra Bold is just the right strength.  The decaf is also great.  Would recommend it to everyone. TL;DR:

summary: Quite good for the baby that has not yet or is in the process of teething
text: We bought the pack of 6 almost five months ago for our baby boy and we still have one left after giving several of them away. He likes them and will eat them, but he is not mad about them. It really made a difference though during the teething process. TL;DR:

My two Cavaliers were constantly scratching, so I decided to try an Omega 3 supplement. I'm pleased wirh this product and so are the dogs. I have tried other VentriScience products with success. Works as advertised. TL;DR:

I LOVE this dressing!! I only like Norma's dressing on salads.  It has a very unique full body flavor and delicious. I also like to marinate fish and chicken with it.  My family loves it.  Norma is a powerhouse, and such an excellent example of healthy living!!  My bottles go fast, so I buy several at a time. TL;DR:

This cheesecake is better than the plain, if that is possible. I will have to try the others now.
I am very pleased that Amazon is carrying the gluten free products as it is easy and fast to get.
I have asked local stores to order certain products for me without success. Being a senior citizen,
ordering my favorite products from Amazon is hassle free. TL;DR:

The Blueberry Cool Brew Black Tea that Celestial Seasonings discontinued was much better.  This one was bland to my taste.  I wish they still had the Blueberry Cool Brew in Black Tea instead of Green Tea because it was the best iced tea I had ever tasted! TL;DR:

Good basic tea!  I start everyday with a cup. Bergamont is helpful to reduce anxiety, lower cholesterol and protect brain neurons, so double is a good thing! Get it on auto ship so you never run out and save $$. TL;DR:

text: This tastes like regular tea, mixed with vanilla creamer & powdered creamer, which I could easily make myself. The only authentic thing about it in my opinion was the orangish color. TL;DR:

This is great stuff, highly recommended if you want to avoid pork products. You will have to at least warm up the liquid it will go into, otherwise, it won't fully dissolve. This is also a great source of protein for those who can't stomach the taste of whey or soy products. TL;DR:

This product is amazingly tasty.  I am not fond of coconut, and I love, love, love this stuff.  It's especially good with vanilla yogurt and fresh blueberries.  My children like to snack on it, too. TL;DR:

summary: great idea, wonder if they have Nespresso ship for them too
text: Two stars. One for the idea to sell someones product at double the cost, and one for all the stars out there that actually bought these from them. Hats off and enjoy the coffee. I think if you do the math now it's like $300 dollars a pound. TL;DR:
Not much to review other than the fact that this is a pretty good deal, four boxes for $12. The cereal itself is  good as well, and its also pretty healthy TL;DR:

summary: Yum!!  Much better than Cracker Jacks!
text:
For those times when your sweet tooth is calling, this is a fulfilling snack! The chocolate is not only drizzled on the top but the bottom of each huge kernel is covered. The popcorn tastes freshly popped with just the right combination of crunch and softness. Unlike Cracker Jacks, the carmel does not stick to your teeth, nor break them on hard pieces.

While not nutrition rich, at 130 calories per package and 25 calories of fat, this is a nice occasional snack.

I was sent a box free under the Amazon Vine program; however, think the Snack Well folks made a good investment as I plan to buy more! TL;DR:

summary: Nice, light, and full of flavor
text:
My wife and I have been very pleased with both the clementine and pomegranate flavors of he Izze sparkling soda. The drinks are refreshing, but with a natural flavor - unlike many of the sports drinks.

Other tidbits of information-

- Each can has 80 calories- which is very similar to a can of soda of the same size.

- While the "clementine" and the "pomegranate" flavors only contain real fruit juice- it may not be the juices you have in mind. Both are sweetened by a combination of grape and apple juices. The grape and pomegranate juice comes a little further down on the list.

- While each drink contains vitamins - I wouldn't count on them as being a significant source of anything.

Final score- we really enjoy the taste and serving size. In fact, Izze makes a great ice cold drink for a warm summer day! TL;DR:

summary: Stash brand tea my all-time favorite
text:
I checked my past orders of the Stash brand Earl Grey Double-Bergamot tea. It seems I order about once every 8 months. This is now my 3rd order but the first time I bought it in bulk like this. The savings were minimal but worth it. I made sure to count all the bags to ensure a complete order was received. It was.

I was surprised to find a video by someone who spoke of Earl Grey as a vile and disgusting tea. I love this tea. However, I have met people that I have offered a cup of this tea, and a few have mentioned it smelled like pepper to them. Bergamot, the predominant spice in this tea, is a citrus not unlike an orange whose oils are extracted for this tea. When I smell the tea, I smell a sweet aroma. If, when you smell this tea, it smells like pepper to you, you might first give it at least one sip before dismissing it. I typically put cream & sugar in my this. TL;DR:
This vinegar is outstanding!  Sweet and savory with mellow acidity. Great on salads and vegetables even pasta.  You will want to covet this vinegar, so buy one for your friends! TL;DR:

Mixed it up and had a glass. Liked the flavor as did some of my family members, but I'm really not fond of the sucralose in it, hence the reason for only 4 stars. I was under the impression that it was sweetened with honey and that turned out to be only partially true. TL;DR:

This is my favorite iced tea ever. I do not prefer sugary sweet beverages (my second favorite iced tea is unsweetened), so this is perfect for me. The combination of mint, green tea, and a touch of organic cane sugar make for a refreshing beverage at any time of day. TL;DR:
Even those who don't have to be gluten free love these cookies! They have a wonderful taste and texture with no weird after taste. Most excellent with a cup of tea. TL;DR:

Ok, so this is mostly msg and some seasoning spices.  But, if you can eat msg and salt, this is the best seasoning ever!  I use it to make soup bases, in shepherd's pie, to make gravy, and even as a soup by itself.  It is the secret ingredient used by chefs to enhance food tastes.  It is totally an amazing seasoning that makes everything taste better.  I am allergic to milk, so I even use it mixed with water instead of milk and butter in mashed potatoes.  If you can eat msg and salt, try it.  You won't be disappointed. TL;DR:

summary: My toddler LOVES these!  I wish they made these for adults as well.
text:
These may not be the #1 healthiest snack for toddlers, but they are very good. The flavor is perfect. It's not too strong, nor too bland. They have a touch of salt, but it's not nearly as salty as many alternatives. They are just the right size for little hands. They're crunchy, yet dissolve easily. In fact, these were my toddler's first finger food. I often like to go with store brands to save money, but I've found that the taste of these is quite superior.

As my toddler is getting older, I'm not buying these as often as I used to since they are expensive. However, when she was still in the early stages of eating table foods, these were awesome. I'm actually a little bummed that I'm not going to be getting them all that often anymore. TL;DR:

I love these noodles and ordered by bulk directly from Konjac. This will be an ongoing order for me. They come packed in a water tight bag. You just rinse, add your other ingredients and heat up. There is a strong fish smell upon opening. However, once they are rinsed and mixed with other foods, they automatically take on the taste of the food. Just as good as spaghetti.  The bags are 9 oz. each and it feeds two people, even though it does not look that big. Excellent for low carb diets. I'll never use regular pasta again. TL;DR:

summary: Trappist jellies & jams are great stuff!
text:
They taste great.

They're pretty!

They're made in an intriguing and enviro-friendly way. (My first sight of the monastery where they're made - a replica of the mother-house in Europe, on a picturesque hilltop in Massachusetts - swept me into a historical reverie that was interrupted when I realized what the habited monk on the red tile roof was doing: fixing one of the solar panels powering the jelly factory. You can read more about some unique features of the process on the Amazon site.)

And the money you spend actually goes to support the life and work of the monks. TL;DR:
I bought this ball for my standard poodle. It didn't take him long before he was kicking it around & getting to the treats. He did become board with it. TL;DR:
I got and tried the Walden Farms Marshmallow Dip.  Don't waste your money... it tastes like poison with a terrible aftertaste. YUCK. TL;DR:

My primary reason for buying this product was to help my digestive system. I have iron deficiency anemia, but I could not tolerate any brand of iron supplement, and the shots were extremely painful. So I became extremely anemic and needed transfusions. Consequently, I couldn't take a chance anymore on not using iron tablets and I had to find a way to take them without suffering.
Because I use coconut oil and milk in my cooking and for skin/hair care, I've done research on the benefits of this amazing seed, and I thought that these capsules might help me to tolerate iron tablets. Well they have, and I am now able to tolerate 3 daily doses of ferrous sulfate, so I'm in compliance with my doctors orders and my hemoglobin level is rising. TL;DR:

summary: The best for a winter tea party!
text: This tea smells and tastes like Christmas! This has always been my family's favorite tea for children's (and big kid's) tea parties. TL;DR:

summary: a great tea hot or cold
text:
I was looking for a lower caffeine tea that still offered flavor, and this vanilla apricot tea fit the bill. I drink a lot of iced tea, and have found that brewing this double strength and pouring it over ice makes a great iced tea. I usually drink it unsweetened. As was mentioned in a previous review the apricot flavor is not quite as refined as is offered in a high quality tissane, but it is still quite good. I took a chance in ordering this tea (6 boxes!), but I am really glad I did. It's my go-to flavored tea, especially in the afternoon and evening.

Because I live in a small town, my options for tea purchases are limited to whatever the grocery store or Wal-Mart stocks. Thank God I can order tea from Amazon! TL;DR:

I bought this for my bf since he loves Maker's Mark.  He loved this sauce too, although the bottle is kind of small.  We marinated chicken in it and also used it to dip steak in.  It has a great flavor.  I need to buy more! TL;DR:

I got the candy in a bag with a green sticker tie on it the packaging was all right had a tear in it but wasnt opened and was what i ordered i have to admit they are almost gone now will order again from seller TL;DR:

summary: Very tasty and not overly sweet
text:
I love this stuff! It's a true Italian espresso taste and it's not overly sweet like most other cappuccino drinks that I've tried. It has a hint of chocolate from the cocoa powder.

As with most of these drinks on the market there is quite a bit of sugar 19g carbs, (sugars 18g), but that is less than my other favorite coffee drink. This only has 1.5 fat grams, which is pretty good.

Overall, I'd highly recommend if you like a treat that isn't overly sweet and has a nice espresso taste. TL;DR:

It also has little bits and pieces of either passion fruit or Aloe Vera that make it fun to drink as the tasty bits are a burst of flavor.
